column4: Joebu[NoR] : did you run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" after you installed it to get proper resolutions again?
it wont let me boot at all with the card installed
Joebu[NoR] : you can get to a term.. use ctrl+alt+f1
I'll try that.  when do I hit ctrl+alt+f1?
Joebu[NoR] : after it's booted... you won't have a GUI display since it has no driver
it doesn't boot with the card in.  it freezes at the ubuntu splash screen
Joebu[NoR] : try the "recovery" kernel
tried that, I get nothing, freezes after a minute or so
Joebu[NoR] : can you boot a livecd?  you can use that to mount your root then edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
I will try that
if i can get the PCI busID, then I can jsut change the xorg fiile, correct?
Joebu[NoR] : that... and the driver to "nv"
will try
Joebu[NoR] : run "lspci" from a term to get the PCI ID
how can I tell what fs I am using?
Joebu[NoR] : ?  to mount it?  just run the mount command
dont you need to specify file system?
Joebu[NoR] : it should autodetect... chances are you're using ext3 though
i'm going to say 14 days
burner: all it mounted was hda1, which only lists the kernels
Joebu[NoR] : still there?
yep
found pci busid
